intro: Kickxia azraqensis, commonly known as the Azraq spurflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Azraq Basin in Jordan. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in limestone soils. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are usually blue or violet in color, which bloom during the spring season. Its scientific name reflects its geographical origin and distinctive floral characteristics. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
